channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #229 - Seven more days of advent!
item.description:
The first 3 weeks of December are always a great time for Perl articles:
there are seven Perl 5/CPAN articles and seven Perl 6 ones to keep you
busy until next week.


The London Perl Workshop was on Saturday. If you were there, why not
blog your thoughts on it in time for next week's issue?


Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Senior Applications Engineer
item.description: Uniregistry is looking for a talented and passionate engineer to build and maintain a world-class registry and registrar. This position requires the ability to analyze and implement elegant solutions to complex problems while contributing to the development of reusable components

item.title: Supporting the Perl Weekly?
item.description: Would you like to support the Perl Weekly? A Perl Job ad in the Perl Weekly, like the one above, will reach almost 6000 Perl developers. People like you, who are enthusiastic about Perl and not just use it as an add-on tool.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - November 2015
item.description: David's monthly round-up of new modules on CPAN. No module of the month this month, so I guess we all need to try harder in December.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Release of Validator::Custom 1.01
item.description: Kimoto-san has updated his Validator::Custom module, and gives a taster of some of the changes.

item.title: P5P summary: November 30th - December 7th
item.description: 6 bugs were reported, 11 bugs were resolved, the release of Perl 5.22.1 was postponed, and a load of discussion on regex vs regexp (I prefer the former, as most seem to, but ref(qr//) returns Regexp, so we're stuck with both).

item.title: Perl 5 advent
item.description: Quick links to the last week's articles, by module: Text::Hogan, Reply, Web::Query, Module::CPANFile, Smart::Comments, Config::Station, JSON::Path.

item.title: Array references in Perl
item.description: A tutorial on using array references in Perl 5.

item.title: Perl6's newline conversion behavior seems to be by design
item.description: Sinan noticed that Perl 6's handling of newline characters, which has been mentioned in various blogs recently, can cause problems on Windows. This follows on from an earlier post where he hit the issue.

item.title: Adventing Commences
item.description: The usual weekly round-up of Perl 6 news, blog posts, and links to the first week's articles in the Perl 6 advent calendar.

item.title: Perl 6 advent
item.description: Quick links to the Perl 6 topics covered in the last week: unicode, grammars, grey wolf optimiser, pod, first impressions, given/when, traits.

item.title: Double-oh seven
item.description: An update from Carl on his 007 project, a little language that he's been working on to help think and learn about how to do macros.

item.title: Dada Mail v9 Released
item.description: Dada Mail is an email list manager written in Perl. Justin announced the release of version 9.

item.title: TWiki-6.0.2 Released - Better Usability, Better App Platform
item.description: Twiki is a (or the?) Structured Wiki written in Perl. It is actually so much more than a Wiki.

item.title: Monitoring heating oil levels with a webcam
item.description: Robin uses an infra red webcam and a perl script to monitor the level of heating oil in a large tank.

item.title: Create GitHub files automatically with Dist::Zilla
item.description: David shows how he uses Dist::Zilla to ensure that certain files from his CPAN distributions appear in the github repo, even though they're generated by Dist::Zilla, and thus usually won't be found in repos.

item.title: Counter with Dancer sessions
item.description: A short tuturial on creating a counter with the Dancer web framework.

item.title: Dave Cross's slides
item.description: Dave gave a tutorial, a talk, and a lightning talk at the London Perl Workshop on Saturday. He's put the slides for all three online.

item.title: NEILB's report on LPW 2015
item.description: My notes on LPW this year, and also encouraging people who've never spoken at a Perl event to consider giving a talk next year.

item.title: Hack retreat
item.description: One way to make serious progress on a personal project is to block out a weekend, prepare appropriately beforehand, then use the weekend (or however long) to get some focus.

item.title: What we talk about when we talk about distributed systems
item.description: A good primer on the various concepts in and around distributed systems, with links to further reading on the various topics.

item.title: Choosing an HTTP Status Code â€” Stop Making It Hard
item.description: A handy set of diagrams to help you understand the different HTTP status codes, and which ones to use when.
